item.title: Indeed和Glassdoor将在以人工智能为重点的整合中裁员1300人
item.description: Indeed和Glassdoor均为日本集团Recruit Holdings Co.所有，这两家公司将裁员约1300人，作为合并业务和将更多精力转向人工智能的更广泛举措的一部分。【原文：Indeed and Glassdoor — both owned by the Japanese group Recruit Holdings Co. — are cutting roughly 1,300 jobs as part of a broader move to combine operations and shift more focus toward artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 市场轮动让 S&P 500 指数跌者更跌，赢者更赢
item.description: 美国股市在 7 月份发生了明显的变化：一些上半年表现最差的股票现在表现出色，而年初的赢家则逐渐失宠。【原文：A noticeable shift has been reshaping US equities in the month of July: Some of the biggest laggards from the first half are now outperforming, while the year’s early winners are falling out of favor.】

item.title: 比特币延续创纪录涨势，期权交易商目标 12 万美元
item.description: 比特币期权交易商已经把目光投向了更高的价格，而原始加密货币已经连续第二天延续了破纪录的涨势。【原文：Bitcoin options traders are already setting their sights on much higher prices while the original cryptocurrency extends its record-breaking rally for a second day.】

item.title: 特朗普对巴西征收关税有可能破坏从咖啡到牛肉的贸易
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统出人意料地威胁要对巴西征收 50%的关税，这一举动可能会扰乱全球大宗商品市场，破坏从牛肉到咖啡等各种商品的贸易。【原文：President Donald Trump’s unexpected move to threaten a 50% tariff on Brazil risks roiling global commodity markets, disrupting trade on everything from beef to coffee.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒支持资产负债表清算和结构调整
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，美国央行应能将银行储备水平从目前的 3.26 万亿美元降至 2.7 万亿美元左右。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said the US central bank should be able to lower the level of bank reserves to around $2.7 trillion, from the current level of $3.26 trillion.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利筹划 BetaNXT 私人债务再融资交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）正在为软件平台 BetaNXT 公司的 9.5 亿美元债务再融资杠杆贷款向投资者征询意见，这是私人信贷和广泛银团市场之间活动转移的最新例证。【原文：Morgan Stanley is sounding out investors for $950 million of leveraged loans to refinance software platform BetaNXT Inc.’s debt, according to people familiar with the matter, the latest example of activity shifting between private credit and the broadly syndicated market.】

item.title: 英国隐形初创企业打造类似铁穹的技术，估值达 4 亿美元
item.description: 据多位熟知内情的人士透露，英国一家名为剑桥航空航天公司的新创公司已筹集到约 1 亿美元的早期资金，用于开发拦截无人机和巡航导弹的防御系统。【原文：A new British startup, called Cambridge Aerospace, has raised around $100 million in early capital to develop defense systems for intercepting drones and cruise missiles, according to multiple people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 对墨西哥番茄征税对美国消费者意味着什么？
item.description: 美国人是西红柿的消费大户，每人每年要吃掉近 100 磅西红柿。美国市场全年都有各种肉质水果供应，其中大部分来自墨西哥。如果没有最后一刻的缓和，这些目前免税进入美国的供应品将从 7 月 14 日起被征收 17% 的关税，这与美国今年早些时候对从墨西哥进口的部分产品征收的新关税无关。在美国本土的种植者指责墨西哥同行后，美国官员决定征收番茄税。【原文：Americans are big consumers of tomatoes, taking in nearly 100 pounds per person a year. Barring a last-minute reprieve, those supplies, which now enter the US duty-free, will be hit as of July 14 with a 17% levy, which is unrelated to new tariffs the US imposed on some imports from Mexico earlier this year. item.title: 麦格理支持的液化天然气开发商 WaveCrest 因员工离职而陷入困境
item.description: 所有员工均已离开 WaveCrest Energy 公司，该公司由麦格理支持，在休斯顿附近成立，旨在开发海外液化天然气进口项目。【原文：All of the staff have departed from WaveCrest Energy, a Macquarie-backed company near Houston launched to develop liquefied natural gas import projects abroad.】

item.title: 埃及停止降息，谨慎应对通胀放缓
item.description: 埃及维持利率不变，结束了两轮货币宽松政策，因为对该地区紧张局势和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税影响的警惕超过了通胀放缓的影响。【原文：Egypt left interest rates on hold, snapping two rounds of monetary easing, as caution about tensions in the region and the fallout from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs outweighed slowing inflation.】

item.title: Revolut 正洽谈以 650 亿美元估值募集新资金
item.description: Revolut Ltd. 正在讨论以 650 亿美元的混合估值进行一次和二次融资，这家金融科技公司希望为其在美国的扩张筹集资金。【原文：Revolut Ltd. is in discussions to raise a combination of primary and secondary funding at a blended $65 billion valuation as the fintech looks to raise funds for its US expansion.】

item.title: 巴西政治：卢拉竞相利用特朗普的关税威胁
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普表示将对巴西征收 50%的关税后，路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统承诺将采取自己的报复措施，而他的政府和盟友们则竞相利用这一威胁来获取政治利益。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva pledged to retaliate with measures of his own after Donald Trump said he would impose 50% tariffs on Brazil, while his government and allies raced to seize on the threats for political gain.】

item.title: 英国央行布里登警告七国集团债券价格面临气候变化风险
item.description: 英格兰银行副行长萨拉-布里登（Sarah Breeden）表示，一些资产价格已经开始反映日益增长的气候风险，并警告说极端冲击可能会加速这一进程。【原文：Bank of England Deputy Governor Sarah Breeden said some asset prices are already starting to reflect growing climate risks, warning that extreme shocks could speed up that process.】

item.title: 英国将在 400 年后终止纸质股票以提升城市吸引力
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）试图将英国的资本市场全面数字化，以提高伦敦金融城的竞争力。【原文：The UK will scrap paper stock certificates to cut costs for companies, as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves seeks to fully digitize Britain’s capital markets in a bid to boost the competitiveness of the City.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率在连续五周下跌后攀升
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率在六周内首次上升。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US rose for the first time in six weeks.】

item.title: 超市亿万富翁希望在欧洲建立人工智能千兆工厂
item.description: 德国最大的零售商和连锁超市利德尔（Lidl）的所有者施瓦茨集团（Schwarz Group）正计划向政府争取成为一个大型数据中心的主要开发商，该数据中心对欧洲的人工智能工作至关重要。【原文：The Schwarz Group, Germany’s largest retailer and owner of supermarket chain Lidl, is planning to pitch the government to be the lead developer of a major data center central to Europe’s artificial intelligence efforts.】

item.title: 私人信贷公司利用更多杠杆赢得交易
item.description: 由于面临来自广泛银团市场的激烈竞争，私人信贷公司为潜在借款人提供了一个好处：杠杆作用。【原文：Finding steep competition from the broadly syndicated market, private credit firms are offering one benefit to potential borrowers: leverage.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行发出信号：墨西哥货币宽松步伐可能放缓
item.description: 墨西哥央行表示，在上个月降息半个百分点后，降息步伐可能会放缓。【原文：Mexico’s central bank signaled that the pace of interest rate cuts is likely to slow after last month’s half percentage-point reduction.】

item.title: 日产汽车将通过出售美元和欧元债券融资 45 亿美元
item.description: 日产汽车公司开始出售 45 亿美元的美元和欧元债券，该汽车制造商正努力从巨额年度亏损中恢复过来。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. launched a $4.5 billion sale of dollar- and euro-denominated bonds as the automaker seeks to recover from a massive annual loss that forced it to offer a record-high coupon for one of the tranches.】

item.title: 参议员发出信号：他们准备反击 NASA 削减计划
item.description: 两党参议员都表示，他们计划对特朗普政府提出的削减美国国家航空航天局（NASA）及其科学项目的建议进行反击，从而为与白宫的潜在预算争夺战埋下伏笔。【原文：Senators from both parties signaled they plan to push back against the Trump administration’s proposed cuts to NASA and its science programs, setting up a potential budget battle with the White House.】

item.title: 新丰泰 200 亿美元波多黎各交易被董事会叫停
item.description: 波多黎各财政监督机构拒绝批准一项价值 200 亿美元的天然气供应交易，该交易将使新堡垒能源公司（New Fortress Energy Inc.【原文：Puerto Rico’s finance watchdog is refusing to OK a $20 billion natural gas supply deal that it said would give New Fortress Energy Inc. a near monopoly over the island’s energy future.】

item.title: 公用事业公司要求加价一倍，美国电费将上涨
item.description: 根据能源可负担性倡导组织 PowerLines 的一份新报告，美国电力公司今年迄今已要求增加 290 亿美元的费率，是 2024 年上半年要求增加费率的两倍多。【原文：US electric companies have asked for $29 billion in rate increases so far this year, more than double their requests for the first half of 2024, according to a new report from energy affordability advocacy group PowerLines.】

item.title: 美国铜买家为特朗普关税付出高昂代价
item.description: 智利官员称，如果唐纳德-特朗普总统继续对精炼金属（而非电线等铜产品）征收 50%的关税，美国的铜买家将付出高昂的代价。【原文：US buyers of copper will pay a high price if President Donald Trump pushes ahead with a 50% tariff on refined metal as opposed to copper products such as wiring, according to officials in Chile.】

item.title: 荷兰推出 5000 万欧元基金以聘用顶尖研究人员
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）继续大刀阔斧削减联邦政府资助的科研经费之际，荷兰宣布设立一项5000万欧元（5850万美元）的基金，以吸引国际顶尖研究人员。【原文：The Netherlands has announced a €50 million ($58.5 million) fund to lure top international researchers as US President Donald Trump continues to make sweeping cuts to federally funded science and research.】

item.title: 摩根大通考虑削减中国和印度在新兴市场债券指数中的份额
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）正在考虑削减其旗舰新兴市场指数（包括中国和印度）中最大债券发行商的权重，以反映更广泛的发展中国家债务。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is considering cutting the weight of the largest bond issuers in its flagship emerging-market index — including China and India — as it seeks to reflect a broader range of developing-nation debt.】

item.title: 高盛与皇家贝蒂斯合作为足球场融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）正在制定一项计划，准备举债筹集高达 2.5 亿欧元（约合 2.92 亿美元）的资金，用于西班牙皇家贝蒂斯足球俱乐部（Real Betis Balompie SAD）体育场的翻新工程。【原文：Goldman Sachs is working on a plan to raise as much as €250 million ($292 million) in debt to fund the refurbishing of Spanish football club Real Betis Balompie SAD’s stadium, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华为在中东和东南亚寻找人工智能芯片客户
item.description: 华为技术有限公司正试图向中东和东南亚出口小批量人工智能芯片，试图在英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）主导的市场站稳脚跟，尽管制造方面仍面临挑战。【原文：Huawei Technologies Co. is trying to export small quantities of AI chips to the Middle East and Southeast Asia, an effort to establish a foothold in markets dominated by Nvidia Corp. despite ongoing manufacturing challenges.】
